abstract.text: We discuss main experimental works, where dipole polarizabilities of charged pions have been determined.
Possible reasons for the differences between the experimental data are discussed.
In particular, it is shown that the account of the σ-meson gives a significant correction to the value of the polarizability obtained in the latest experiment of the COMPASS collaboration.

body_text.text: The processes γγ → π 0 π 0 and γγ → π + π − were analyzed in Ref.
body_text.section: V. TWO-PHOTON PRODUCTION OF PION PAIRS

body_text.text: [2,13,20] using DRs with subtraction for the invariant amplitudes M ++ and M +− without an expansion over partial waves.
body_text.section: V. TWO-PHOTON PRODUCTION OF PION PAIRS

body_text.text: The subtraction constants are uniquely determined in these works through the pion polarizabilities.
body_text.section: V. TWO-PHOTON PRODUCTION OF PION PAIRS

body_text.text: The values of polarizabilities have been found from the fit to the experimental data of the processes γγ → π + π − and γγ → π 0 π 0 up to 2500 MeV and 2250 MeV, correspondently.
body_text.section: V. TWO-PHOTON PRODUCTION OF PION PAIRS

body_text.text: As a result the following values of (α 1 −β 1 ) π ± = 13.0 +2.6 −1.9 and (α 1 −β 1 ) π 0 = −1.6±2.2 have been found in these works.
body_text.section: V. TWO-PHOTON PRODUCTION OF PION PAIRS

body_text.text: In addition, for the first time there were obtained quadrupole polarizabilities for both charged and neutral pions.
body_text.section: V. TWO-PHOTON PRODUCTION OF PION PAIRS

body_text.text: The new result of the calculation of the total cross section of the process γγ → π + π − at cos θ cm γγ < 0.6 in the frame of the DRs [13] has been obtained with the σ-meson considered as a pole on the second Riemann sheet.
body_text.section: V. TWO-PHOTON PRODUCTION OF PION PAIRS

body_text.text: The result, using Eq.
body_text.section: V. TWO-PHOTON PRODUCTION OF PION PAIRS

body_text.text: (16) for ImM σ ++ (t, s = µ 2 ) with the following parameters of the σ-meson: M σ = 441 MeV, Γ σ = 544 MeV, Γ σγγ = 1keV, g σππ = 2.924GeV (α 1 − β 1 ) π ± = 10, is shown in Fig. 2.
body_text.section: V. TWO-PHOTON PRODUCTION OF PION PAIRS

body_text.text: However, the region W MeV is most sensitive to the contribution of (α 1 − β 1 ) π ± .
body_text.section: V. TWO-PHOTON PRODUCTION OF PION PAIRS

body_text.text: Therefore, in order to obtain real values of the polarizabilities of the charged pions, it is necessary to have new more accurate data for the process γγ → π + π − in the energy region W < 800 MeV.
body_text.section: V. TWO-PHOTON PRODUCTION OF PION PAIRS

body_text.text: It should be noted that even in the region of W 500 MeV the main contribution is given by the Born term, the dipole and quadrupole polarizabilities, and the σ-meson.
body_text.section: V. TWO-PHOTON PRODUCTION OF PION PAIRS

body_text.text: In conclusion, further experimental and theoretical investigations are needed to determine the true value of the pion polarizabilities.
